item.title: Getting Started with MySQL MCP Server
item.description:
1 Getting Started with MySQL MCP Server Locally

This guide shows you how to set up and use the MySQL Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server on your local machine, focusing on integration with Cursor, an AI-powered code editor.

2 What is MySQL MCP Server?

MySQL MCP Server is a tool that lets AI applications, like Cursor, safely interact with your MySQL database. Instead of writing raw SQL, you can ask questions about your data. The server handles the communication, making database access more structured and secure.

Main github repository is here

item.title: How to use Chrome MCP: a simple guide
item.description: 1 Introductionmcp-chrome (also called Chrome MCP Server) is a Chrome extensionâ€“based MCP (Model Context Protocol) server. It lets MCP clients (e.g. AI agents, chatbots) connect to your regular Chrome/Chromium browser, use your existing login state, and control or inspect web pages. Main GitHub Repo is here 2 Main Features Works with your real browser (no separate headless instance) Fully local (no remote server) Uses streamable HTTP as connection method (or stdio alternative) Semantic search across tabs (vector index) & content analysis Over 20 â€œtoolsâ€ (APIs) to interact with browser: navigation, network, screenshots, DOM, bookmarks, history, etc.

item.title: How to use pnpm: a simple guide
item.description:
1 What is pnpm?

pnpm is a package manager for JavaScript. It is like npm or yarn, but it is faster and uses less disk space.

Why?

  • pnpm saves only one copy of each version of a package.
  • Many projects can share the same files.
  • This makes your computer cleaner and faster.
